alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 8:59PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern San Juan and southern Grand Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 858 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southeast of Canyonlands National Park, or 23 miles west of La Sal, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moab, Castle Valley, La Sal, Spanish Valley, Canyonlands National Park, La Sal Junction, Arches National Park and Dead Horse Point State Park. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 92 and 141. Utah 128 between mile markers 0 and 19. Utah 279 between mile markers 0 and 15. Utah 313 between mile markers 0 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains
